item.title: Seven Guns for the MacGregors
item.description: Seven Guns for the MacGregors is a Technicolor 1966 Italian spaghetti western. It is the directorial debut film of Franco Giraldi, who was Sergio Leone's assistant in A Fistful of Dollars. The film gained a great commercial success and generated an immediate sequel, Up the MacGregors! (1967), again directed by Giraldi, and a later sequel, More Dollars for the MacGregors (1970).

item.title: Sheriff Won't Shoot
item.description: Sheriff Won't Shoot is a 1965 Italian and Spanish Spaghetti Western film.

item.title: Bullet in the Flesh
item.description: Bullet in the Flesh or Il piombo e la carne is a 1964 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Marino Girolami.

item.title: The Price of Power
item.description: The Price of Power is a 1969 Spaghetti Western directed by Tonino Valerii. The film stars Giuliano Gemma as the hero Bill Willer who tries to get revenge against the killers of his father while at the same time trying to prevent an assassination plot against president James Garfield in 1881.

item.title: Cipolla Colt
item.description: Cry, Onion! is a 1975 Spaghetti Western comedy film directed by Enzo G. Castellari. It is openly comedic and parodic.

item.title: Holy God, Here Comes the Passatore!
item.description: Fuori uno sotto un altro... arriva il passatore is a 1973 Italian adventure-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Train for Durango
item.description: Train for Durango is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Mario Caiano.

item.title: The Bounty Killer
item.description: The Ugly Ones is a 1966 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Eugenio Martín.

item.title: Die 7 Pistolen des McGregor
item.description: Die 7 Pistolen des McGregor ist ein Italowestern von Franco Giraldi. Deutsche Erstaufführung war am 5. August 1966. Im Jahr darauf erschien die Fortsetzung Eine Kugel für Mac Gregor.

item.title: Lo sceriffo che non spara
item.description: Lo sceriffo che non spara ist ein Italowestern aus dem Jahr 1965, der im deutschsprachigen Raum bislang keine Aufführung erhielt. Unter der Regie von José Luis Monter spielt Mickey Hargitay eine der Hauptrollen.
